user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of find_entry_by_userinfo:
```c
static struct UserEntry *
find_entry_by_userinfo (const struct MHD_DigestAuthUsernameInfo *username_info)
{
  if (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_STANDARD <= username_info->uname_type)
    return find_entry_by_username (username_info->username);

  if (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_USERHASH == username_info->uname_type)
    return find_entry_by_userhash (username_info->algo3,
                                   username_info->userhash_bin,
                                   username_info->userhash_hex_len / 2);

  return NULL; /* Should be unreachable as all cases are covered before */
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_USERHASH == username_info->uname_type)
    return find_entry_by_userhash (username_info->algo3,
                                   username_info->userhash_bin,
                                   username_info->userhash_hex_len / 2);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 14.3 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: If the numeric value of MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_USERHASH is greater than or equal to MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_STANDARD then the first condition (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_STANDARD <= username_info->uname_type) will also be true for USERHASH values and the function will have already returned. In that case the second controlling expression (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_USERHASH == username_info->uname_type) is effectively always false (invariant) and therefore violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3. (If the enum/definitions guarantee USERHASH < STANDARD then no violation occurs.)
